docs.lead_paragraph: A new thriller starring Will Ferrell and Kristen Wiig will air later this month on Lifetime after experiencing some real-life drama of its own.

headline.main: Lifetime Film With Will Ferrell, Kristen Wiig Debuts June 20
headline.print_headline: Lifetime Film With Will Ferrell, Kristen Wiig Debuts June 20

docs.snippet: A new thriller starring Will Ferrell and Kristen Wiig will air later this month on Lifetime after experiencing some real-life drama of its own.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Republican senator seeking his party's 2016 presidential nomination introduced a bill Thursday banning most late-term abortions and is predicting the Senate will vote on the highly polarizing issue this year.

headline.main: Capitol Hill Buzz: GOP Sen. Graham Offers Abortion Bill
headline.print_headline: Capitol Hill Buzz: GOP Sen. Graham Offers Abortion Bill

docs.snippet: A Republican senator seeking his party's 2016 presidential nomination introduced a bill Thursday banning most late-term abortions and is predicting the Senate will vote on the highly polarizing issue this year.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Georgia woman spent nearly three days in jail without bond before prosecutors decided police had wrongly charged her with murder after being told she had used pills ordered online to terminate her pregnancy.

headline.main: Georgia Woman Who Used Abortion Pills Still Faces Legal Woes
headline.print_headline: Georgia Woman Who Used Abortion Pills Still Faces Legal Woes

docs.snippet: A Georgia woman spent nearly three days in jail without bond before prosecutors decided police had wrongly charged her with murder after being told she had used pills ordered online to terminate her pregnancy.

docs.lead_paragraph: It’s been a dismal stretch across the nation for a woman’s right to choose, but there is some good news from Idaho. Who knew?
docs.abstract: Gail Collins Op-Ed column examines string of disheartening setbacks for woman's right to choose, including federal appeals court decision upholding Texas law that has decimated abortion clinics; observes such laws target poor women who cannot afford to travel for an abortion; cites tragedies that have occurred across country when women take matter into their own hands.
docs.snippet: It’s been a dismal stretch across the nation for a woman’s right to choose, but there is some good news from Idaho. Who knew?

docs.lead_paragraph: A prosecutor dropped a murder charge Wednesday but is pursuing a drug possession count against a woman accused of ending her pregnancy without a prescription, using pills she bought online.

headline.main: Georgia: No Murder Charge for Woman Who Bought Abortion Pills Online
headline.print_headline: Georgia: No Murder Charge for Woman Who Bought Abortion Pills Online

docs.abstract: Dougherty County, Ga, district attorney Greg Edwards drops murder charge against Kenlissia Jones, who is accused of ending her pregnancy with abortion pill obtained without prescription; Edwards is pursuing drug possession count against Jones.
docs.snippet: A prosecutor dropped a murder charge Wednesday but is pursuing a drug possession count against a woman accused of ending her pregnancy without a prescription, using pills she bought online.

docs.lead_paragraph: Women seeking abortions in Florida will be required to make two visits to a clinic, with a mandatory 24-hour waiting period in between.

headline.main: Florida: Governor Signs Law Requiring 24-Hour Wait for Abortion
headline.print_headline: Florida: Governor Signs Law Requiring 24-Hour Wait for Abortion

docs.abstract: Florida Gov Rick Scott signs measure requiring women seeking abortions to make two visits to clinic with mandatory 24-hour waiting period in between.
docs.snippet: Women seeking abortions in Florida will be required to make two visits to a clinic, with a mandatory 24-hour waiting period in between.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Arkansas Attorney General's Office requested a rehearing Wednesday before the U.S. appeals court that agreed last month with a lower court that a state law unconstitutionally burdens women by banning abortions after the 12th week of pregnancy if a doctor can detect a fetal heartbeat.

headline.main: Arkansas Seeking Rehearing in 12-Week Abortion Ban Case
headline.print_headline: Arkansas Seeking Rehearing in 12-Week Abortion Ban Case

docs.snippet: The Arkansas Attorney General's Office requested a rehearing Wednesday before the U.S. appeals court that agreed last month with a lower court that a state law unconstitutionally burdens women by banning abortions after the 12th week of pregnancy if...

docs.lead_paragraph: Women seeking abortions in Florida will be required to make two visits to a clinic, with a mandatory 24-hour waiting period in between, to end a pregnancy under a bill signed into law on Wednesday.

headline.main: Florida Governor Signs Bill Requiring Two Clinic Visits, Waiting Period for Abortion
headline.print_headline: Florida Governor Signs Bill Requiring Two Clinic Visits, Waiting Period for Abortion

docs.snippet: Women seeking abortions in Florida will be required to make two visits to a clinic, with a mandatory 24-hour waiting period in between, to end a pregnancy under a bill signed into law on Wednesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: - Paraguay has been told by a leading human rights watchdog to protect the life and health of a pregnant 10-year-old girl allegedly raped by her stepfather but denied an abortion in a case that has sparked a global outcry.

headline.main: Paraguay Told to Protect Life of Pregnant 10-Year-Old Rape Victim
headline.print_headline: Paraguay Told to Protect Life of Pregnant 10-Year-Old Rape Victim

docs.snippet: - Paraguay has been told by a leading human rights watchdog to protect the life and health of a pregnant 10-year-old girl allegedly raped by her stepfather but denied an abortion in a case that has sparked a global outcry.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Georgia prosecutor dropped a murder charge Wednesday but is pursuing a drug possession count against a 23-year-old woman accused of ending her pregnancy without a prescription, using pills she bought online.

headline.main: Murder Charge Dropped Against Woman Who Induced Abortion
headline.print_headline: Murder Charge Dropped Against Woman Who Induced Abortion

docs.snippet: A Georgia prosecutor dropped a murder charge Wednesday but is pursuing a drug possession count against a 23-year-old woman accused of ending her pregnancy without a prescription, using pills she bought online.
